snippet: With presidential elections approaching in June, the country has cracked down on journalists, rights activists and lawyers in a bid to stifle dissent, the investigator said.
abstract: United Nations investigator Ahmed Shaheed reports widespread, systemic human rights abuses in Iran, including crackdown on journalists, rights activists and lawyers and torture of citizens, in anticipation of upcoming presidential elections in June; Iran rejects assertions, calling them unfounded propaganda done under pressure of the West.
lead_paragraph: With presidential elections approaching in June, the country has cracked down on journalists, rights activists and lawyers in a bid to stifle dissent, the investigator said.

headline.seo: U.N. Rights Investigator Gives Harsh Appraisal of Iran
headline.main: Investigator From U.N. Gives Iran Harsh Review
headline.print_headline: Investigator From U.N. Gives Iran Harsh Review

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
